docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 President Carter welcomed Panama's Chief of Government, Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, to the White House today to open a crowded three-day program of diplomatic activities designed to bolster support for two new Panama Canal...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 President Carter welcomed Panama's Chief of Government, Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, to the White House today to open a crowded three-day program of diplomatic activities designed to bolster support for two new Panama Canal treaties.
docs.abstract: Pres Carter meets with Pres Alfonso Lopez Michelsen, Washington (S)

headline.main: PANAMANIAN LEADER MEETS WITH CARTER; Two Will Sign the Canal Treaties at a Formal Ceremony Today  Many Foreign Chiefs on Hand

byline.original: By GRAHAM HOVEY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept, 7 (AP) The Treasury Department announced today that it is investigating whether imported nonrubber footwear from Uruguay is being subsidized by the Uruguayan Government in violation of the United States trade laws.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept, 7 (AP) The Treasury Department announced today that it is investigating whether imported nonrubber footwear from Uruguay is being subsidized by the Uruguayan Government in violation of the United States trade laws.
docs.abstract: Treas Dept is investigation whether imported nonrubber footwear from Uruguay is being subsidized by Uruguayan Govt in violation of US trade laws (S)

headline.main: U.S. Checking Uruguyan Footwear To See If Products Are Subsidized

headline.main: A List of the Leaders At Treaty Ceremony

docs.snippet: "There is no Panama Canal! There is an American canal at Panama," runs the new slogan of opponents to the two canal treaties signed in Washington last night. The antiseptic preposition "at" tells the story: Treaty opponents would have the American...
docs.lead_paragraph: "There is no Panama Canal! There is an American canal at Panama," runs the new slogan of opponents to the two canal treaties signed in Washington last night. The antiseptic preposition "at" tells the story: Treaty opponents would have the American people overlook the fact that the canal is in Panama and is there because of a one-sided treaty imposed upon a days-old Republic of Panama 74 years ago.
docs.abstract: ed lauds signing of treaties; urges Sen ratification

docs.snippet: The passage of time is notoriously swift.  Last night in Madison Square Garden, Willie Pep stuck his hand through a shower curtain and shook hands with Alexis Arguello. The young and classy Arguello, who relinquished his world junior lightweight...
docs.lead_paragraph: The passage of time is notoriously swift. Last night in Madison Square Garden, Willie Pep stuck his hand through a shower curtain and shook hands with Alexis Arguello. The young and classy Arguello, who relinquished his world junior lightweight title because he had conquered all opposition, had just scored the 44th knockout of his brilliant boxing career.

headline.main: Arguello Stops Artis in 2d Round for 44th Knockout

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 5 President Carter signed two 11-year-old covenants on human rights today, fulfilling a pledge and eliminating a source of embarrassment for those who favor a forceful rights campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 5 President Carter signed two 11-year-old covenants on human rights today, fulfilling a pledge and eliminating a source of embarrassment for those who favor a forceful rights campaign.
docs.abstract: Pres Carter signs two 11-yr-old covenants on human rights, fulfilling pledge he made at UN in March; declines to sign optional annex on civil and pol rights that would have enabled complaints to be heard by a human rights com (M)

headline.main: U.S., Fulfilling Promise, Signs ll-Year-0ld Rights Pacts at U.N.

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCH Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A horse from Uruguay that won at Belmont Park last month at odds of 57-1 was declared ineligible by the New York Racing Association yesterday until his identity can be verified.
docs.lead_paragraph: A horse from Uruguay that won at Belmont Park last month at odds of 57-1 was declared ineligible by the New York Racing Association yesterday until his identity can be verified.
docs.abstract: Lebon, Uruguayan horse that recently won at Belmont at 57-1 odds, is declared ineligible by NY Racing Assn until his identity can be verified; Uruguayan newspaperman say horse is not Lebon but Cinzano (S)
